revised_title: Glycogenic Changes in the Placenta and Foetus of the Pregnant Rabbit
tldr: This study investigates the glycogenic changes in the placenta and foetus of pregnant rabbits, contributing to the understanding of the role of glycogen in foetal development. The research examines the distribution and amount of glycogen in various tissues and its relation to foetal growth and maternal diet. The findings suggest that glycogen plays a significant role in the development of the foetus and its absorbed from the placenta.
